description: A technique where Doflamingo attaches nearly invisible strings to his target's body, allowing him to puppeteer their movements like a marionette. The victims are unable to resist and can be forced to perform any action, including fighting and killing their allies. He can control multiple people simultaneously with apparent ease.

firstUse.context: Doflamingo uses Parasite to control Bellamy and Sarquiss, forcing them to fight each other as punishment for losing to Luffy.

mechanics: Attaches thin, nearly invisible strings to target's body
Allows complete control over target's physical movements
Victims are conscious but unable to resist control
Controlled movements match the user's finger motions
strengths: Can force allies to fight each other
Can control multiple people at once
Victims remain conscious, adding psychological torment
weaknesses: Requires line of sight or proximity to target
User must maintain control through finger movements
combatApplications: Forcing enemies to fight each other
Using controlled victims as shields or weapons
trainingRequired: Unknown - appears to be an advanced application of the Ito Ito no Mi
significance: This is the first major demonstration of Doflamingo's devil fruit abilities in the series, establishing him as a formidable Warlord with terrifying control powers. The technique showcases the Ito Ito no Mi's potential for psychological and physical manipulation.
culturalNotes: Named after parasitic organisms that control their hosts
Reflects the puppeteer/marionette theme of the Ito Ito no Mi

sources.title: Ito Ito no Mi - One Piece Wiki
